hi,
the problem is the JUnit task is unable to find the java program in the Test directory specified.
 
<property name="tst-dir" location="ShoppingCartApplication" />
 
 <path id="classpath.test">
    <pathelement location="/junit3.8.1/junit.jar" />
    <pathelement location="${tst-dir}" />
  </path> 
 
<target name="test" depends="compile-test">
     <junit printsummary="true" fork="true" haltonfailure="true">
  <classpath refid= "classpath.test"/>
  <formatter type="plain"/>
  <test name="ShoppingCartApplication.ShoppingApplicationTestSuite" outfile="result">    
   <formatter type="xml"/>
  </test>
 </junit>
  </target>
 
Hope this snippet from the build.xml file helps, 
 
if it still doesnt Run the JUnit task,
Add .(dot) to your classpath system variable.this wd take ur current path.
Approach 2 is not recommended, but u cd still give dat a try

Mukta

Jason Rogers <jacaetevha@...> wrote:
venkat9985 wrote:

> HI,
> can anyone helps me how to set class path for junit....and how to
> run.....iam able to compile but i cann't run the junit prgm.....iam
> getting the following error..plz help me...
>
>
>
>
> C:\junitfaq>java junitfaq.SimpleTest
> Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError:
> junitfaq/SimpleTest
>
> C:\junitfaq>

Well, without knowing your setup I would suggest this:

    java -cp . junitfaq.SimpleTest

This is not a JUnit problem though.  It sounds like you need to expand 
your understanding of classpaths.

--
